citations.narrative:
The indoor portion of all the sheltered enclosures had an excessive buildup of old food waste, debris and grime. This can
affect the health of the animals and can possibly make the dogs ill. Enclosures must be spot cleaned daily and sanitized
at least once every two weeks to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. The license must address
this issue by cleaning enclosures more frequently.
*******Correct by August 1, 2024

Standing water was observed in an enclosure housing two dogs. The license stated that the drain was not working
properly. This can cause distress to the animals as well as potential illness since standing water can harbor bacteria and
other disease-causing agents. Drainage systems need to be maintained so that they are operating properly. In addition,
any standing water must be removed from animal enclosures. The licensee must correct this issue.
******Correct by August 1, 2024

Three enclosures each housing two dogs had measurable temperatures which were more than the allowable upper
range. The dogs are housed in den style enclosures, which did not did not have operating fans at the time of inspection.
The dogs were observed panting excessively. Ambient outside temperature was greater than 85°F at the time of
inspection.
Extreme temperatures can affect the health and wellness of the dogs and cause excessive stress. The licensee noted that
the power supply for the fans was not operating. Auxiliary ventilation, such as fans, must be provided when the ambient
temperature is 85° F or higher. The fans were operating at the conclusion of the inspection.
*********Corrected by July 16, 2024 at the time of inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
